grid

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • grid.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    A map of the game, containing a set of tiles and all objects within. In the grid ##### #...# #..@# #...# ##### The player @ is at location map[2][3].
    Author:
    Matt Imel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid(FocusComponent fc)
      Creates an empty grid with default dimensions.
      Grid(int height, int width, FocusComponent fc)
      Creates an empty grid with set dimensions.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of the map.
        Returns:
        The height of the map.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth(int row)
        Gets the width, in tiles, of a row.
        Parameters:
        row - The row.
        Returns:
        The length of stated row.

      • getXFocus

        public int getXFocus()
        Gets the X position of the focused tile.
        Returns:
        -1 if there is no focused tile, any zero/positive integer otherwise, indicating the X position.

      • getYFocus

        public int getYFocus()
        Gets the Y position of the focused tile.
        Returns:
        -1 if there is no focused tile, any zero/positive integer otherwise, indicating the Y position.

      • drawGrid

        public void drawGrid(int width,
                     int height)
        Draws the grid, focused on either the player or the manual focus. This method is preferably called with odd-numbered parameters, though it should handle even-numbered dimensions well.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the tile array to draw.
        height - The height of the tile array to draw.

      • setFocusedTile

        public void setFocusedTile(int newX,
                           int newY)
        Sets the current focus, if there exists no focused tile.
        Parameters:
        newX -
        newY -

      • clearFocusedTile

        public void clearFocusedTile()
        Clears the focused tile by setting the focused tile to a location out of bounds.

      • resetGrid

        public void resetGrid()
        Resets the grid to a clean state consisting of empty tiles (?).

      • fillGrid

        public void fillGrid(java.lang.String terrain)
        Fills the grid with tiles according to the character string inserted, from the top left, going right, then down, to the bottom right. If the character string is shorter than the number of tiles in the grid, the remainder are filled with empty (?) tiles. Excess characters are cropped.
        Parameters:
        terrain - The character string to insert as the map.

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int x,
                      int y)
        Attempts to get a tile within the map at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-coordinate of the tile requested.
        y - The Y-coordinate of the tile requested.
        Returns:
        The tile if it can be found, or null if it can't.

      • setTileAt

        public boolean setTileAt(int x,
                         int y,
                         Tile t)
        Attempts to set a tile within the map at the specified coordinates to a specific Tile.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-coordinate of the tile requested.
        y - The Y-coordinate of the tile requested.
        t - The Tile to replace the current one.
        Returns:
        If the operation was successful, returns true. Else, returns false.

      • moveEntity

        public boolean moveEntity(int xOcc,
                          int yOcc,
                          int xOffset,
                          int yOffset)
        Attempts to move an entity from one tile to another.
        Parameters:
        xOcc - The X-coordinate of the tile the entity is occupying.
        yOcc - The Y-coordinate of the tile the entity is occupying.
        xOffset - The X-shift where the entity will go.
        yOffset - The Y-shift where the entity will go.
        Returns:
        True if the entity was successfully moved, False if not.

      • searchForOccupant

        public Occupant searchForOccupant(int id)
        Searches for an entity within the grid, given the id.
        Parameters:
        id - The id to look up.
        Returns:
        The entity if it can be found, or null if it can't.

      • switchFocus

        public void switchFocus(int xOffset,
                        int yOffset)
        Switches the crosshair location to a tile relative to the one the crosshair is currently on. If there is no crosshair in the given tile, that tile becomes focused. Else, the the "isFocused" flag switches between the given tile and the tile plus offsets.
        Parameters:
        xFocus - The X-coordinate of the crosshair.
        yFocus - The Y-coordinate of the crosshair.
        xOffset - The X-shift where the entity will go.
        yOffset - The Y-shift where the entity will go.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
